abstract: Dr William F Martin study in journal Nature Microbiology reports scientists have generated genetic portrait of ancestor of all living things, single-cell organism non as the Last Universal Common Ancestor, or Luca, that lived some four billion years ago; portrait points to organism that lived in conditions similar to those currently found near volcanic deep-sea vents.

headline.print_headline: Meet Luca, Ancestor of All Living Things
headline.main: Meet Luca, the Ancestor of All Living Things

snippet: A single-cell, bacterium-like organism clinging to volcanic sea vents may have been the forebear of every animal, plant and microbe on earth....
lead_paragraph: A single-cell, bacterium-like organism clinging to volcanic sea vents may have been the forebear of every animal, plant and microbe on earth.
